org.semanticweb.kaon2.api.flogic
Interface FMethodCall

public interface FMethodCall

Represents a method call in an F-molecule.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object accept(KAON2Visitor visitor)
          Accepts a visitor.
 FMethodCall apply(java.util.Map<Variable,Term> substitution)
          Returns the method call obtained by replacing free variables according to the specified substitution.

          Returns the argument with given index.

          Returns the array of all arguments.

          Adds the free variables of this method call to the supplied set.

 boolean isClosed()
          Returns true if this method call is closed---that is, if it does not have free variables.

          Returns true if this term is ground---that it, if it does not contain a variable.

Parameters:

Returns:
the argument with given index

getArguments

Term[] getArguments()
Returns the array of all arguments. The returned array is not owned by this objet and can be freely changed.

Returns:
the arguments of this term

getType

FMethodCallType getType()
Returns the type of this method call.

Returns:
the type of this method call

getNumberOfResults

int getNumberOfResults()
Returns the number of results.

Returns:
the number of results of this method call

getResultTerm

Term getResultTerm()
Returns the term of the zeroth result. This is a shortcut method for getResultTerm(0), often used for single-valued method calls.

Returns:
the term of the zeroth result

getResultFMolecule

FMolecule getResultFMolecule()
Returns the F-molecule of the zeroth result. This is a shortcut method for getResultFMolecule(0), often used for single-valued method calls.

Returns:
the F-molecule of the zeroth result (or null)

getResultTerm

Term getResultTerm(int resultIndex)
Returns the term of the result with the given index.

Parameters:
resultIndex - the index of the required result
Returns:
the term of the result with given index

getResultFMolecule

FMolecule getResultFMolecule(int resultIndex)
Returns the F-molecule listed as the result with given index. If the result with given index is not an F-molecule, null is returned.

Parameters:
resultIndex - the index of the required result
Returns:
the F-molecule of the result with given index, or null if given result is not an F-molecule

getResults

java.lang.Object[] getResults()
Returns the array of results. The resulting array is not owned by this object and cann be freely changed. The members are either FMolecule or Term objects.

Returns:
the array of results

replaceParts

FMethodCall replaceParts(Term newMethodName,
                         Term[] newArguments,
                         FMethodCallType newMethodCallType,
                         java.lang.Object[] newResults)
Creates a new object with certain parts replaced. This method attempts to be memory efficient by reusing unchanged arrays.

Parameters:
newMethodName - the new name of the method
newArguments - the new arguments (or null if the arguments should not be replaced)
newMethodCallType - the new type of the metod call
newResults - the new results (or null if the results should not be changed

getFreeVariables

java.util.Set<Variable> getFreeVariables()
Returns the set of the free variables of this method call.

Returns:
the set of the free variables

getFreeVariables

void getFreeVariables(java.util.Set<Variable> freeVariables)
Adds the free variables of this method call to the supplied set.

Parameters:
freeVariables - the set receiving the free variables

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Returns true if this method call is closed---that is, if it does not have free variables. Hence, this method returns true if and only if getFreeVariables().isEmpty() returns true; however, this method may be faster.

Returns:
true if this formula is closed

isGround

boolean isGround()
Returns true if this term is ground---that it, if it does not contain a variable.

Returns:
true if this term is ground

apply

FMethodCall apply(java.util.Map<Variable,Term> substitution)
Returns the method call obtained by replacing free variables according to the specified substitution.

Parameters:
substitution - the substitution
Returns:
the result of applying the substitution to the method call

Returns:
the result of the visitor

              Namespaces namespaces)
Writes this object to the supplied string buffer.
